ygData.msgSnippet: Also, make sure you have a pix directory inside your openglad directory. The folder permissions might be wrong. Try going into your pix directory and putting a

Also, make sure you have a pix directory inside your openglad directory. 

The folder permissions might be wrong. Try going into your pix
directory and putting a file in it or something to make sure you can
write to that directory. This could be an issue if you are using WinXP
and NTFS.

Sean

--- In gladiator@yahoogroups.com, "Tom Ricket" <TRicket@b...> wrote:
> For the map error -- I haven't looked in a long time, but one issue with
> the old game was that it had problems saving to directories that
> contained a space (like "C:\Program Files\Gladiator") ... Try making
> sure the game is in C:\Glad (or something short), and run setup to make
> sure it knows the directory, and see if it's any happier.
> 
> --Tom 
>
